page.title: 05St. Lucia's church cont.
page.content: In the church yard there are yew trees, and they were used for defence. People fashioned longbows from the wood, the bow was made of wood from the yew tree, because the wood can bend without breaking. There are still marks that can be seen today on the outside of the church wall, where people used to sharpen arrow heads. The oldest grave stone in the church yard that can still be seen today,was put there in 1737.We found evidence of 209 tombs and grave stones that are still existing today in the church yard. You can still see the grave of Hugh Dryden Corbet who died December 5th 1936.He was Lord of the manor at Sundorne.Most of his family were burried in St. Lucia's church yard.
